page.title: 17Farming - The Butley Area
page.content: Farming in this area has changed over the last twenty five years. Irrigation, improved land drainage ,scientific and technological developments have meant that the land can be used for more arable farming. At last, farmers have stopped taking out hedges and are planting trees and shelter belts which are helping in conservation of both wildife and soil. There are three main types of soil in the area, sand, clay and loam. The sand is used for crops like barley, green beans and rye. In periods of drought this type of soil has to be well irrigated. The clay, on the other hand, is much too wet and must be drained well before it can be used. Wheat is grown here. Loam, a mixture of clay and sand, is good for growing most crops. There is very little livestock in this area.
